1:04

1:07

 - (Romans 3:8) And why not say (as we are slanderously reported and as some claim that we say), "Let us do evil that good may come"? Their condemnation is just.
 - (1 Corinthians 3:8) Now he who plants and he who waters are one; but each will receive his own reward according to his own labor.
 - (2 Corinthians 3:8) how will the ministry of the Spirit fail to be even more with glory?
 - (Galatians 3:8) The Scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the Gentiles by faith, preached the gospel beforehand to Abraham, saying, "ALL THE NATIONS WILL BE BLESSED IN YOU."
 - (Ephesians 3:8) To me, the very least of all saints, this grace was given, to preach to the Gentiles the unfathomable riches of Christ,
 - (Philippians 3:8) More than that, I count all things to be loss in view of the surpassing value of knowing Christ Jesus my Lord, for whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and count them but rubbish so that I may gain Christ,
 - (Colossians 3:8) But now you also, put them all aside: anger, wrath, malice, slander, and abusive speech from your mouth.
 - (1 Thessalonians 3:8) for now we really live, if you stand firm in the Lord.

 - (1 Timothy 3:8) Deacons likewise must be men of dignity, not double-tongued, or addicted to much wine or fond of sordid gain,
 - (2 Timothy 3:8) Just as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so these men also oppose the truth, men of depraved mind, rejected in regard to the faith.
 - (Titus 3:8) This is a trustworthy statement; and concerning these things I want you to speak confidently, so that those who have believed God will be careful to engage in good deeds. These things are good and profitable for men.
 - (Hebrews 3:8) DO NOT HARDEN YOUR HEARTS AS WHEN THEY PROVOKED ME, AS IN THE DAY OF TRIAL IN THE WILDERNESS,
 - (James 3:8) But no one can tame the tongue; it is a restless evil and full of deadly poison.
 - (1 Peter 3:8) To sum up, all of you be harmonious, sympathetic, brotherly, kindhearted, and humble in spirit;
 - (2 Peter 3:8) But do not let this one fact escape your notice, beloved, that with the Lord one day is like a thousand years, and a thousand years like one day.
 - (1 John 3:8) the one who practices sin is of the devil; for the devil has sinned from the beginning. The Son of God appeared for this purpose, to destroy the works of the devil.
 - (Revelation 3:8) 'I know your deeds. Behold, I have put before you an open door which no one can shut, because you have a little power, and have kept My word, and have not denied My name.

 - (John 5:46) "For if you believed Moses, you would believe Me, for he wrote about Me.

5:47
 - (Matthew 5:47) "If you greet only your brothers, what more are you doing than others? Do not even the Gentiles do the same?
 - (John 5:47) "But if you do not believe his writings, how will you believe My words?"

5:48
 - (Matthew 5:48) "Therefore you are to be perfect, as your heavenly Father is perfect.

12:32

 - (Deuteronomy 12:32) "Whatever I command you, you shall be careful to do; you shall not add to nor take away from it.
 - (1 Kings 12:32) Jeroboam instituted a feast in the eighth month on the fifteenth day of the month, like the feast which is in Judah, and he went up to the altar; thus he did in Bethel, sacrificing to the calves which he had made. And he stationed in Bethel the priests of the high places which he had made.
 - (1 Chronicles 12:32) Of the sons of Issachar, men who understood the times, with knowledge of what Israel should do, their chiefs were two hundred; and all their kinsmen were at their command.
 - (Nehemiah 12:32) Hoshaiah and half of the leaders of Judah followed them,
 - (Matthew 12:32) "Whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man, it shall be forgiven him; but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit, it shall not be forgiven him, either in this age or in the age to come.
 - (Mark 12:32) The scribe said to Him, "Right, Teacher; You have truly stated that HE IS ONE, AND THERE IS NO ONE ELSE BESIDES HIM;
 - (Luke 12:32) "Do not be afraid, little flock, for your Father has chosen gladly to give you the kingdom.
 - (John 12:32) "And I, if I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all men to Myself."

12:33
 - (Exodus 12:33) The Egyptians urged the people, to send them out of the land in haste, for they said, "We will all be dead."
 - (1 Kings 12:33) Then he went up to the altar which he had made in Bethel on the fifteenth day in the eighth month, even in the month which he had devised in his own heart; and he instituted a feast for the sons of Israel and went up to the altar to burn incense.
 - (1 Chronicles 12:33) Of Zebulun, there were 50,who went out in the army, who could draw up in battle formation with all kinds of weapons of war and helped David with an undivided heart.
 - (Nehemiah 12:33) with Azariah, Ezra, Meshullam,
 - (Matthew 12:33) "Either make the tree good and its fruit good, or make the tree bad and its fruit bad; for the tree is known by its fruit.
 - (Mark 12:33) AND TO LOVE HIM WITH ALL THE HEART AND WITH ALL THE UNDERSTANDING AND WITH ALL THE STRENGTH, AND TO LOVE ONE'S NEIGHBOR AS HIMSELF, is much more than all burnt offerings and sacrifices."
 - (Luke 12:33) "Sell your possessions and give to charity; make yourselves money belts which do not wear out, an unfailing treasure in heaven, where no thief comes near nor moth destroys.
 - (John 12:33) But He was saying this to indicate the kind of death by which He was to die.

12:34
 - (Exodus 12:34) So the people took their dough before it was leavened, with their kneading bowls bound up in the clothes on their shoulders.
 - (1 Chronicles 12:34) Of Naphtali there were 1,captains, and with them 37,000 with shield and spear.
 - (Nehemiah 12:34) Judah, Benjamin, Shemaiah, Jeremiah,
 - (Matthew 12:34) "You brood of vipers, how can you, being evil, speak what is good? For the mouth speaks out of that which fills the heart.
 - (Mark 12:34) When Jesus saw that he had answered intelligently, He said to him, "You are not far from the kingdom of God." After that, no one would venture to ask Him any more questions.
 - (Luke 12:34) "For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
 - (John 12:34) The crowd then answered Him, "We have heard out of the Law that the Christ is to remain forever; and how can You say, 'The Son of Man must be lifted up'? Who is this Son of Man?"

12:35
 - (Exodus 12:35) Now the sons of Israel had done according to the word of Moses, for they had requested from the Egyptians articles of silver and articles of gold, and clothing;
 - (1 Chronicles 12:35) Of the Danites who could draw up in battle formation, there were 28,600.
 - (Nehemiah 12:35) and some of the sons of the priests with trumpets; and Zechariah the son of Jonathan, the son of Shemaiah, the son of Mattaniah, the son of Micaiah, the son of Zaccur, the son of Asaph,
 - (Matthew 12:35) "The good man brings out of his good treasure what is good; and the evil man brings out of his evil treasure what is evil.
 - (Mark 12:35) And Jesus began to say, as He taught in the temple, "How is it that the scribes say that the Christ is the son of David?
 - (Luke 12:35) "Be dressed in readiness, and keep your lamps lit.
 - (John 12:35) So Jesus said to them, "For a little while longer the Light is among you. Walk while you have the Light, so that darkness will not overtake you; he who walks in the darkness does not know where he goes.

12:36
 - (Exodus 12:36) and the LORD had given the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians, so that they let them have their request. Thus they plundered the Egyptians.
 - (1 Chronicles 12:36) Of Asher there were 40,who went out in the army to draw up in battle formation.
 - (Nehemiah 12:36) and his kinsmen, Shemaiah, Azarel, Milalai, Gilalai, Maai, Nethanel, Judah and Hanani, with the musical instruments of David the man of God. And Ezra the scribe went before them.
 - (Matthew 12:36) "But I tell you that every careless word that people speak, they shall give an accounting for it in the day of judgment.
 - (Mark 12:36) "David himself said in the Holy Spirit, 'THE LORD SAID TO MY LORD, "SIT AT MY RIGHT HAND, UNTIL I PUT YOUR ENEMIES BENEATH YOUR FEET."'
 - (Luke 12:36) "Be like men who are waiting for their master when he returns from the wedding feast, so that they may immediately open the door to him when he comes and knocks.
 - (John 12:36) "While you have the Light, believe in the Light, so that you may become sons of Light." These things Jesus spoke, and He went away and hid Himself from them.

12:37
 - (Exodus 12:37) Now the sons of Israel journeyed from Rameses to Succoth, about six hundred thousand men on foot, aside from children.
 - (1 Chronicles 12:37) From the other side of the Jordan, of the Reubenites and the Gadites and of the half-tribe of Manasseh, there were 120,with all kinds of weapons of war for the battle.
 - (Nehemiah 12:37) At the Fountain Gate they went directly up the steps of the city of David by the stairway of the wall above the house of David to the Water Gate on the east.
 - (Matthew 12:37) "For by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned."
 - (Mark 12:37) "David himself calls Him 'Lord'; so in what sense is He his son?" And the large crowd enjoyed listening to Him.
 - (Luke 12:37) "Blessed are those slaves whom the master will find on the alert when he comes; truly I say to you, that he will gird himself to serve, and have them recline at the table, and will come up and wait on them.
 - (John 12:37) But though He had performed so many signs before them, yet they were not believing in Him.

12:38
 - (Exodus 12:38) A mixed multitude also went up with them, along with flocks and herds, a very large number of livestock.
 - (1 Chronicles 12:38) All these, being men of war who could draw up in battle formation, came to Hebron with a perfect heart to make David king over all Israel; and all the rest also of Israel were of one mind to make David king.
 - (Nehemiah 12:38) The second choir proceeded to the left, while I followed them with half of the people on the wall, above the Tower of Furnaces, to the Broad Wall,
 - (Matthew 12:38) Then some of the scribes and Pharisees said to Him, "Teacher, we want to see a sign from You."
 - (Mark 12:38) In His teaching He was saying: "Beware of the scribes who like to walk around in long robes, and like respectful greetings in the market places,
 - (Luke 12:38) "Whether he comes in the second watch, or even in the third, and finds them so, blessed are those slaves.
 - (John 12:38) This was to fulfill the word of Isaiah the prophet which he spoke: "LORD, WHO HAS BELIEVED OUR REPORT? AND TO WHOM HAS THE ARM OF THE LORD BEEN REVEALED?"

12:39
 - (Exodus 12:39) They baked the dough which they had brought out of Egypt into cakes of unleavened bread. For it had not become leavened, since they were driven out of Egypt and could not delay, nor had they prepared any provisions for themselves.
 - (1 Chronicles 12:39) They were there with David three days, eating and drinking, for their kinsmen had prepared for them.
 - (Nehemiah 12:39) and above the Gate of Ephraim, by the Old Gate, by the Fish Gate, the Tower of Hananel and the Tower of the Hundred, as far as the Sheep Gate; and they stopped at the Gate of the Guard.
 - (Matthew 12:39) But He answered and said to them, "An evil and adulterous generation craves for a sign; and yet no sign will be given to it but the sign of Jonah the prophet;
 - (Mark 12:39) and chief seats in the synagogues and places of honor at banquets,
 - (Luke 12:39) "But be sure of this, that if the head of the house had known at what hour the thief was coming, he would not have allowed his house to be broken into.
 - (John 12:39) For this reason they could not believe, for Isaiah said again,

12:40
 - (Exodus 12:40) Now the time that the sons of Israel lived in Egypt was four hundred and thirty years.
 - (1 Chronicles 12:40) Moreover those who were near to them, even as far as Issachar and Zebulun and Naphtali, brought food on donkeys, camels, mules and on oxen, great quantities of flour cakes, fig cakes and bunches of raisins, wine, oil, oxen and sheep. There was joy indeed in Israel.
 - (Nehemiah 12:40) Then the two choirs took their stand in the house of God. So did I and half of the officials with me;
 - (Matthew 12:40) for just as JONAH WAS THREE DAYS AND THREE NIGHTS IN THE BELLY OF THE SEA MONSTER, so will the Son of Man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.
 - (Mark 12:40) who devour widows' houses, and for appearance's sake offer long prayers; these will receive greater condemnation."
 - (Luke 12:40) "You too, be ready; for the Son of Man is coming at an hour that you do not expect."
 - (John 12:40) "HE HAS BLINDED THEIR EYES AND HE HARDENED THEIR HEART, SO THAT THEY WOULD NOT SEE WITH THEIR EYES AND PERCEIVE WITH THEIR HEART, AND BE CONVERTED AND I HEAL THEM."

12:41
 - (Exodus 12:41) And at the end of four hundred and thirty years, to the very day, all the hosts of the LORD went out from the land of Egypt.
 - (Nehemiah 12:41) and the priests, Eliakim, Maaseiah, Miniamin, Micaiah, Elioenai, Zechariah and Hananiah, with the trumpets;
 - (Matthew 12:41) "The men of Nineveh will stand up with this generation at the judgment, and will condemn it because they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and behold, something greater than Jonah is here.
 - (Mark 12:41) And He sat down opposite the treasury, and began observing how the people were putting money into the treasury; and many rich people were putting in large sums.
 - (Luke 12:41) Peter said, "Lord, are You addressing this parable to us, or to everyone else as well?"
 - (John 12:41) These things Isaiah said because he saw His glory, and he spoke of Him.

12:42
 - (Exodus 12:42) It is a night to be observed for the LORD for having brought them out from the land of Egypt; this night is for the LORD, to be observed by all the sons of Israel throughout their generations.
 - (Nehemiah 12:42) and Maaseiah, Shemaiah, Eleazar, Uzzi, Jehohanan, Malchijah, Elam and Ezer. And the singers sang, with Jezrahiah their leader,
 - (Matthew 12:42) "The Queen of the South will rise up with this generation at the judgment and will condemn it, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, something greater than Solomon is here.
 - (Mark 12:42) A poor widow came and put in two small copper coins, which amount to a cent.
 - (Luke 12:42) And the Lord said, "Who then is the faithful and sensible steward, whom his master will put in charge of his servants, to give them their rations at the proper time?
 - (John 12:42) Nevertheless many even of the rulers believed in Him, but because of the Pharisees they were not confessing Him, for fear that they would be put out of the synagogue;

12:43
 - (Exodus 12:43) The LORD said to Moses and Aaron, "This is the ordinance of the Passover: no foreigner is to eat of it;
 - (Nehemiah 12:43) and on that day they offered great sacrifices and rejoiced because God had given them great joy, even the women and children rejoiced, so that the joy of Jerusalem was heard from afar.
 - (Matthew 12:43) "Now when the unclean spirit goes out of a man, it passes through waterless places seeking rest, and does not find it.
 - (Mark 12:43) Calling His disciples to Him, He said to them, "Truly I say to you, this poor widow put in more than all the contributors to the treasury;
 - (Luke 12:43) "Blessed is that slave whom his master finds so doing when he comes.
 - (John 12:43) for they loved the approval of men rather than the approval of God.

12:44
 - (Exodus 12:44) but every man's slave purchased with money, after you have circumcised him, then he may eat of it.
 - (Nehemiah 12:44) On that day men were also appointed over the chambers for the stores, the contributions, the first fruits and the tithes, to gather into them from the fields of the cities the portions required by the law for the priests and Levites; for Judah rejoiced over the priests and Levites who served.
 - (Matthew 12:44) "Then it says, 'I will return to my house from which I came'; and when it comes, it finds it unoccupied, swept, and put in order.
 - (Mark 12:44) for they all put in out of their surplus, but she, out of her poverty, put in all she owned, all she had to live on."
 - (Luke 12:44) "Truly I say to you that he will put him in charge of all his possessions.
 - (John 12:44) And Jesus cried out and said, "He who believes in Me, does not believe in Me but in Him who sent Me.

12:45
 - (Exodus 12:45) "A sojourner or a hired servant shall not eat of it.
 - (Nehemiah 12:45) For they performed the worship of their God and the service of purification, together with the singers and the gatekeepers in accordance with the command of David and of his son Solomon.
 - (Matthew 12:45) "Then it goes and takes along with it seven other spirits more wicked than itself, and they go in and live there; and the last state of that man becomes worse than the first. That is the way it will also be with this evil generation."
 - (Luke 12:45) "But if that slave says in his heart, 'My master will be a long time in coming,' and begins to beat the slaves, both men and women, and to eat and drink and get drunk;
 - (John 12:45) "He who sees Me sees the One who sent Me.

12:46
 - (Exodus 12:46) "It is to be eaten in a single house; you are not to bring forth any of the flesh outside of the house, nor are you to break any bone of it.
 - (Nehemiah 12:46) For in the days of David and Asaph, in ancient times, there were leaders of the singers, songs of praise and hymns of thanksgiving to God.
 - (Matthew 12:46) While He was still speaking to the crowds, behold, His mother and brothers were standing outside, seeking to speak to Him.
 - (Luke 12:46) the master of that slave will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he does not know, and will cut him in pieces, and assign him a place with the unbelievers.
 - (John 12:46) "I have come as Light into the world, so that everyone who believes in Me will not remain in darkness.

12:47
 - (Exodus 12:47) "All the congregation of Israel are to celebrate this.
 - (Nehemiah 12:47) So all Israel in the days of Zerubbabel and Nehemiah gave the portions due the singers and the gatekeepers as each day required, and set apart the consecrated portion for the Levites, and the Levites set apart the consecrated portion for the sons of Aaron.
 - (Matthew 12:47) Someone said to Him, "Behold, Your mother and Your brothers are standing outside seeking to speak to You."
 - (Luke 12:47) "And that slave who knew his master's will and did not get ready or act in accord with his will, will receive many lashes,
 - (John 12:47) "If anyone hears My sayings and does not keep them, I do not judge him; for I did not come to judge the world, but to save the world.

12:48
 - (Exodus 12:48) "But if a stranger sojourns with you, and celebrates the Passover to the LORD, let all his males be circumcised, and then let him come near to celebrate it; and he shall be like a native of the land. But no uncircumcised person may eat of it.
 - (Matthew 12:48) But Jesus answered the one who was telling Him and said, "Who is My mother and who are My brothers?"
 - (Luke 12:48) but the one who did not know it, and committed deeds worthy of a flogging, will receive but few. From everyone who has been given much, much will be required; and to whom they entrusted much, of him they will ask all the more.
 - (John 12:48) "He who rejects Me and does not receive My sayings, has one who judges him; the word I spoke is what will judge him at the last day.

12:49
 - (Exodus 12:49) "The same law shall apply to the native as to the stranger who sojourns among you."
 - (Matthew 12:49) And stretching out His hand toward His disciples, He said, "Behold My mother and My brothers!
 - (Luke 12:49) "I have come to cast fire upon the earth; and how I wish it were already kindled!
 - (John 12:49) "For I did not speak on My own initiative, but the Father Himself who sent Me has given Me a commandment as to what to say and what to speak.

12:50
 - (Exodus 12:50) Then all the sons of Israel did so; they did just as the LORD had commanded Moses and Aaron.
 - (Matthew 12:50) "For whoever does the will of My Father who is in heaven, he is My brother and sister and mother."
 - (Luke 12:50) "But I have a baptism to undergo, and how distressed I am until it is accomplished!
 - (John 12:50) "I know that His commandment is eternal life; therefore the things I speak, I speak just as the Father has told Me."

12:51
 - (Exodus 12:51) And on that same day the LORD brought the sons of Israel out of the land of Egypt by their hosts.
 - (Luke 12:51) "Do you suppose that I came to grant peace on earth? I tell you, no, but rather division;

12:52
 - (Luke 12:52) for from now on five members in one household will be divided, three against two and two against three.

12:53
 - (Luke 12:53) "They will be divided, father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother-in-law against daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law."

12:54
 - (Luke 12:54) And He was also saying to the crowds, "When you see a cloud rising in the west, immediately you say, 'A shower is coming,' and so it turns out.

12:55
 - (Luke 12:55) "And when you see a south wind blowing, you say, 'It will be a hot day,' and it turns out that way.

12:56
 - (Luke 12:56) "You hypocrites! You know how to analyze the appearance of the earth and the sky, but why do you not analyze this present time?

12:57
 - (Luke 12:57) "And why do you not even on your own initiative judge what is right?

12:58
 - (Luke 12:58) "For while you are going with your opponent to appear before the magistrate, on your way there make an effort to settle with him, so that he may not drag you before the judge, and the judge turn you over to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.

12:59
 - (Luke 12:59) "I say to you, you will not get out of there until you have paid the very last cent."
